resources.string: A brilliant architectural beauty is a historical fort in Delhi, Red Fort which was the main residence of the emperors of the Mughal Dynasty for more than 200 years. The Mughal families lived there until 1857
Netaji Subhash Marg, Lal Qila, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi 110006.

India Gate is an important site to visit when on your tour to Delhi. India Gate has its original name as All India War Memorial that was built in order to commemorate the 82000 soldiers of the Indian Army who lost their lives during the First World War happened from 1914 to 1921 as well as in the Third Anglo-Afghan War. The war memorial is situated at Rajpath where you can reach by getting down at Barakhamba Road Metro station in Delhi
Rajpath Marg, India Gate, New Delhi, Delhi 110001.

Qutub Minar is made of red sandstone and marble making its height up to 73 meters and gives a tower like structure to it which is consisted of five stories and its diameter is 14.3 meters at the base and it becomes 2.7 meters at the top.
Qutub Minar Delhi is situated in Mehrauli in South West district of New Delhi, India.

The Lotus Temple is among the famous tourist places in Delhi and a major landmark of India that has been attracting tourists from all over the world because of its architecture and beauty. The construction of the temple was finished in 1986. It resembles the lotus flower but created in white colour.
Lotus Temple Rd, Bahapur, Shambhu Dayal Bagh, Kalkaji, New Delhi, Delhi 110019.

Among the temples in Delhi, Akshardham Temple or Swaminarayan Akshardham Complex is amazingly famous as it is known to be a spiritual and cultural campus in Delhi. This complex showcases the traditional Hindu and Indian culture, spirituality and architecture.

Among the five major Jantar Mantar constructed by Maharaja Jai Singh II of Jaipur, the one in which Delhi has an equal reputation as of the Jaipur one. At Delhi Jantar Mantar, there are 13 architectural astronomy instruments.
Sansad Marg, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001.

Maqbera e Humayun or the Humayun\â€™s Tomb in Delhi is a major historical site in India. It is the tomb of the famous Mughal emperor of India Humayun. It was commissioned by the first wife of Humayun who was the chief consort as well, Empress Bega Begum in 1569-70.
Opposite Dargah Nizamuddin, Mathura Road, New Delhi, Delhi 110013.

This informal hotel in an area with businesses is a 2-minute walk from MCD Park, 4 km from shops and casual eateries at the 3-hectare Dilli Haat marketplace, and 12 km from the Indira Gandhi International Airport.
EA-190,NEAR COMMUNITY CENTRE, Block EA, Tagore Garden, Tagore Garden Extension, New Delhi, Delhi 110027
This palatial luxury hotel is 6.8 km from the Qutub complex and 7.9 km from Humayun\'s Tomb.
Africa Ave, Diplomatic Enclave, Chanakyapuri, New Delhi, Delhi 110023
The modern rooms have flat-screen TVs, DVD players, minibars and paid Wi-Fi. Suites add living/dining rooms and/or kitchenettes. Room service is available.
Dr Zakir Hussain Marg, Delhi Golf Club, Golf Links, New Delhi, Delhi 110003
Set 4.2 km from the Sulabh International Museum Of Toilets, this boutique hotel is 14 km from Buddha Jayanti Park.
A-1/300, Block A1, Janakpuri, New Delhi, Delhi 110058
Polished rooms and suites in a posh hotel offering 3 upscale restaurants, a spa and an outdoor pool.
1, Man Singh Rd, South Block, Man Singh Road Area, New Delhi, Delhi 110001

The luxurious, elegant rooms have flat-screen TVs, minibars and free Wi-Fi. Suites add living rooms and dining rooms, as well as access to a lounge and a gym; some include balconies. An upgraded suite features a kitchen and a library. Room service is available 24/7.
1, Man Singh Rd, South Block, Man Singh Road Area, New Delhi, Delhi 110001
Built in 1931, this elegant hotel is 3 km from the New Delhi train station, 3 km from the India Gate monument and 5 km from the 17th-century landmark Red Fort.
Janpath Ln, Janpath, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001
Indian Accent, rated as the no. 1 restaurant in India, showcases an Inventive Indian menu.
The Lodhi, Lodhi Rd, CGO Complex, Pragati Vihar, New Delhi, Delhi 110003
Sizable, upscale hotel restaurant with unique, smart decor offering a global buffet and cocktails.
Ashoka Rd, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001
The Dakshin is an award-winning restaurant at The Sheraton New Delhi that promises to take guests on an unparalleled gastronomic journey
International dishes are available from this spacious beamed hotel dining room around the clock.
J W Marriott Hotel, Aerocity, Indira Gandhi International Airport, New Delhi
Dum pukht had got beautiful ambience wid cozy environment. Great ambience with cozy interiors.Great fine dining restaurant.Do try their awesomelicious mutton kebabs(mouth watering).
TC Maurya, Sardar Patel Marg, Akhaura Block, Diplomatic Enclave, Chanakyapuri, New Delhi, Delhi 110021
ITC Maurya, Sardar Patel Marg, Akhaura Block, Diplomatic Enclave, Chanakyapuri, New Delhi, Delhi 110021
Lavishly appointed art deco dining room serving a range of dishes from across Asia cuisines.
Connaught Place is a frenetic business and financial hub, centered on a ring of colonnaded Georgian-style buildings with global chain stores, vintage cinemas, bars and Indian restaurants.

n the heart of Old Delhi, Chandni Chowk is a busy shopping area with markets full of spices, dried fruit, silver jewelry and vivid saris, while the narrow side streets are crowded with tiny shops selling essential oils, stationery and traditional Indian sweets.
Dilli Haat is a paid-entrance open-air food plaza and craft bazaar located in Delhi, run by Delhi Tourism and Transportation Development Corporation.
Palika Bazaar, is an underground market located between the inner and outer circle of Connaught Place, Delhi, India. It is named after Palika Bazaar of Mumbai.
Karol Bagh, also spelled as Qarol Bagh, ), is a mixed residential-cum-commercial neighbourhood in Delhi, India, known for its shopping streets, like the Ghaffar Market and Ajmal Khan Road.
Lajpat Nagar is centered on the sprawling Central Market, a colorful maze of narrow lanes with stalls and shops selling vivid saris, embroidered fabrics, kitchenware and herbal cosmetics.
Sarojini Nagar is a neighbourhood in South West Delhi district of Delhi, India. It was one of the sites of the 29 October 2005 Delhi bombings.
